1:
Blessed is he who is concerned for the weak;\q in the day of trouble, Yahweh will rescue him.
\q
3:
Yahweh will support him on the bed of suffering;\q you will make his bed of sickness into a bed of healing.


\q
4:
I said, "Yahweh, have mercy on me!\q Heal me, for I have sinned against you."
\q
5:
My enemies speak evil against me, saying,\q 'When will he die and his name perish?'
\q
7:
All who hate me whisper together against me;\q against me they hope for my hurt.
\q
8:
They say, "An evil disease holds on tightly to him;\q now that he is lying down, he will rise up no more."
\q
9:
Indeed, even my own close friend, in whom I trusted,\q who ate my bread,
\q has lifted up his heel against me.


\q
10:
But you, Yahweh, have mercy on me and raise me up\q so that I may pay them back.
\q
11:
By this I know that you delight in me,\q for my enemy does not triumph over me.
\q
12:
As for me, you support me in my integrity\q and will keep me before your face forever.


\q
13:
May Yahweh, the God of Israel be praised\q from everlasting to everlasting.
\q Amen and Amen.



\ms Book Two
